alert.note: Alert for Cottle; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 04 at 3:30PM CDT until October 04 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Cottle County in northwestern Texas... Southern Motley County in northwestern Texas... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 330 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing intense heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in parts of the area. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paducah, Matador, Swearingen, Hackberry and Roaring Springs. New storms will train across areas that have have seen intense rainfall already this afternoon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
